reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wasnt expecting very much from a travelodge but this is the worst place I have stayed. Difficult to park, wierd entrance with no reception, rooms too hot, constant sound of traffic outside, rubbish breakfast with instant coffee and pretty useless staff. I know people only stay at places like this for somewhere to crash but it was a pretty unpleasant place to crash. I think other Travelodges are a lot better than this one.
reviews.title: Rubbish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price I paid at the Travelodge there aer many more hotels and B & B's available with more ammenities. As I found out when I got there, travelodges in England are bare minimum. This one was supposed to be a new hotel, looks like they bought used furniture from other hotels because everything was worn out. No phone, no toileteries, one towel ( if you ask for more you'll get one towel), the bed had a dip in the center so I had no choice but to keep rolling down into this dip, I ended up sleeping on the couch. Do not order the internet ahead of time... Mine never worked and the hotel has no control of it so they have to argue with this IT company, They finally called to try to fix the problem after I had already checked out of the hotel, so not only did I waste the money but I ended up going downstairs and paying for the use of the computer in the lobby.
reviews.title: Don't stay here if you are travelling without a cell phone

reviews.text: The place stunk really bad, not sure what the putrid smell was but the hallways are separted by doors and it just happened to be that I was in the section where the smell was the worst!! The only good thing I can say about this place is that the shower was good. Oh and for those of you who believe in the "10 minute walk to town", to them 10 minutes equates to 30 minutes, if you are told that its a 15 minute walk then you're talking almost an hour walk. For the price this place was a junk yard, save a little more and stay at Premiers if you're looking for the chain type hotels.
reviews.title: Too good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I remember when Travelodges first appeared on the side of main roads around the country. They were clean and cheap at £35 a night room only. That must have been 25 years ago.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.text: Fast-forward to 2009. The country is full of budget hotels. I find that I no longer know exactly what I'm getting with Travelodge. Some of them are truely awful. Guildford Travelodge is not - it's quite nice. It's the little things that let it down.
reviews.title: CLEAN AND GOOD VALUE

reviews.text: where do i start....... well, firstly, on arrival at approx 20:30 the car park was overfull, rammed with gym fatties. when i got to the reception the lady that should of been serving me was more interested in texting on her mobile phone! when finally i caught her attention, she spent 5 mins logging on whilst pretending to be the hotel manager, talking down to the other members of staff. after what seemed like an eternity i was released into the travelodge corridors only to find i had been given the wrong room key. i returned to the delightful receptionist who was again playing with her phone (she did appologise) and gave me a new key. this time it was for a room that already had peoples belongings in. at this point i just wanted to leave. 45 mins after arriving at the hotel i finally got a room that was just about clean, but it WAS vacant. by the time i got back down to bar, food was almost over. what i had couldnt really be called food, i like to call it stodge. but on a brighter note, all the bar staff were very nice and very accomodating considering how they had been spoken to by the wannabe manager moments earlier. i did have a few issues through the night, not enough towels, a pillow the width of a pancake, no soap. the night staff were great, very polite and considerate. really about the only credit to the hotel. i was woken during the night by youngsters in the corridor mucking about. but by the time i got dressed to go outside, one of the night staff was already on the case and was escorting them back to their room. in the morning i opted out of breakfast based on what i had eaten the night before. but i did hear people complaining about the lack of hot food, so i was please i didnt bother! i got to speak the real manager eventually, whos appologies were not heartfelt, didnt seem to care about the issues i had. her peoples skills were rubbish. do not stay at this hotel, unless you are not paying!!!
reviews.title: Amazingly Poor EVERYTHING!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Standard travelodge however in a wet and rainy summer staying on the 4th floor was like sleeping in the tropics. The bad design of the building means that even with the heating off rooms were like a sauna even with the windown open. When I complained the following morning I was told they had fans available! Great if you want to be kept awake all night by the noise.
reviews.title: Rubbish

reviews.text: Also the breakfast chef seems to have trouble catering for the amount of people staying over the weekend. When we turned up they had run out of scrambled eggs, bacon and sausages. He then brought out some bacon which vanished in seconds and the wait began again. If I would have known how painful the process would be I would have headed to a local cafe.
reviews.title: Basic but comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: close to the Guildford Business Park, nice breakfast (if you pay for it), friendly staff at the reception. Affordable. Good value if you don't need anything fancy. Wifi internet in the rooms (additional charge).
reviews.title: Good location and real value for money...

reviews.text: The bad: close to a highway (but not too noisy), far from Guildford city center (5 minutes taxidrive).
reviews.title: New hotel and well located

likes.disliked: — No facilities - food etc inside the hotel

reviews.text: I've been staying at the Guildford Travelodge every week since December 2008 as a business traveller, staying 3 or 4 nights per week.
reviews.title: Standard Well Below even what Travelodge should provide - Terrible, Awful and Useless Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Over the past few months, however, the standard has been progressively dropping and I note from other reviews that what I've experienced is not unusual. Specifically, we're talking about things like the following:
reviews.title: Accommodation average. breakfast poor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) Broken taps
reviews.title: Friendly staff and good location but cleanliness not good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Broken lights
reviews.title: Great if you don't like sleeping.

reviews.text: 3) Toilet seats either broken or missing
reviews.title: Comfortable for a budget stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The parking at this hotel is shared with a gym and a restaurant, which means parking is very limited. We arrived at 5.30 and the car park was full and because it was full it was very difficult to turn around in, especially as a local business also use it to park their large vans across peoples parked cars!! We spent around 35 minutes trying to park, when my wife went in to ask if there was anywhere else we could park the staff were not helpful (it was another guest who came to help us). Eventually we got parked, and stayed 1 night out of 3 that we should have been staying. The room itself was fine just what you expect from travelodge but the parking really put me off staying here. Then in the morning a big delivery lorry spent 45 minutes trying to get around the back of the car park. I would not have wanted to be the owner of the expensive looking BMW and Jags that he nearly hit several times performing a 99 point turn in the car park!
reviews.title: Severe lack of parking that is shared with a busy 24 hour gym.

reviews.text: There are not that many hotels in Guildford, but there are quite a few businesses in that town. The Travelodge seems to be one of the only decently priced (less than 150 euro per night) hotels in town and close to the surrey research park. Unfortunately it's still way to expensive for what you get. The rooms are incredibly basic (eg. no phones) and not all that clean (the red sofabed in my room had big white stains all over). The rooms are also not exactly inviting to reside in very long which is not nice if you have to stay there a longer than 1 or 2 nights.
reviews.title: Since there's no better around

likes.liked: — The location to the surrey park

reviews.text: The staff could be friendlier also. The one thing that surprised me was the quality of the food at the bar (still bar-food but well prepared).
reviews.title: What you expect of a Travelodge

likes.disliked: — nothing - it was your basic Travelodge

reviews.text: I think anyone who would open a decent hotel for a decent price in Guildford would create a killer business
reviews.title: If you have no better place

reviews.text: Hotel was clean and warm. We had a good sized family room for two - at a £30 rate which I felt was value for money. Just no frills at all. No complaints either. We ate out in town, so not able to comment on food.
reviews.title: Tired building
